scripture: Father, please give the church in the state of Benin people who can build up holiness and faithfulness to you. Ephesians 4:11-12
Jesus, remind the disciples in Benin to train each other to obey all that you commanded, and that you will be with them as they do it. Matthew 28:20
Spirit, please defend the believers in Benin against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Father, your Word can be a lamp to the feet of the Brazil who claim to know you, if they open it and read it today. Psalm 119:105
Please, give courage and opportunity to your children to speak boldly. Ephesians 6:19
Jesus, your return is closer than when we first believed. Please, set urgency in the hearts of the people living in Brazil. Romans 13:11
Father, help the believers in Brazil to know your commands and to do them. Ezra 7:10
Father, please send teachers of your Word to Brazil who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Holy Spirit, help the fearful in Burundi to submit to God and resist the devil. James 4:7
Father, help your children in Burundi find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation. John 4:29–30
Jesus, make yourself known to the people living in the world today through the partners and believers today. Psalm 19:3-4
Father, encourage your church that you never forsake them. Psalm 9:10
The Lord is near to the people in Cambodia. When you call upon him; you call upon him in truth. Psalms 145:18
Good Shepherd, thank you that you know the name of each of the believers in Cambodia. John 10:14
Father, send out Jim and let  him challenge people like Peter who said, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you" in Cameroon. Acts 2:38
Lord, the believers in Camaroon, need our partners to feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up. Jeremiah 3:15

In all things I have shown you that by working hard in this way we must help the weak and remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’” Acts 20:35
Whoever has a bountiful eye will be blessed, for he shares his bread with the poor. Proverbs 22:9
I have made you, and I will carry you. I will sustain you, and I will rescue you. Isaiah 46:4
We who are strong have an obligation to bear with the failings of the weak, and not to please ourselves. Romans 15:1:
Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, Matthew 28:19
"And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased." Hebrews 13:16
Religion that is pure and undefiled before God the Father is this: to visit orphans and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained from the world. James 1:27 ESV

country: Democratic Republic Of The Congo, Central Africa
scripture: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow due to change. James 1:17
Whoever is generous to the poor lends to the LORD, and he will repay him for his deed. Proverbs 19:17

But if anyone has the world's goods and sees his brother in need, yet closes his heart against him, how does God's love abide in him? Little children, let us not love in word or talk but in deed and in truth. 1 John 3:17-18
In every thing give thanks, for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you. 1 Thess 5:18

Be filled with the Spirit; speaking one to another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody with your heart to the Lord; giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God, even the Father. Ephesians 5:18-20
Give thanks to the God of heaven, For His lovingkindness (graciousness, mercy, compassion) endures forever. Psalm 136:26 AMP

Don’t be anxious about anything; rather, bring up all of your requests to God in your prayers and petitions, along with giving thanks. Then the peace of God that exceeds all understanding will keep your hearts and minds safe in Christ Jesus. Philippians 4:6-7
You will know the truth, and the truth will set you free. John 8:32
Discipline yourself for Godliness. 1 Timothy 4:7

When the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all the truth, for he will not speak on his own authority, but whatever he hears he will speak, and he will declare to you the things that are to come. John 16:13
The LORD is near to all who call on him, to all who call on him in truth. Psalm 145:18
God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth. John 4:24
I will hurry, without delay, to obey your commands.Psalm 119:60 NLT
Lead me in your truth and teach me, for you are the God of my salvation; for you I wait all the day long. Psalm 25:5
"Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all people, especially to those who belong to the family of believers." Galatians 6:10
"Give to everyone who asks you, and if anyone takes what belongs to you, do not demand it back."Luke 6:30
"Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to act." Proverbs 3:27

When Moses’ hands grew tired, they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held his hands up—one on one side, one on the other—so that his hands remained steady till sunset. Exodus 17:12
Carry each other’s burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. Galatians 6:2
God is not unjust; he will not forget your work and the love you have shown him as you have helped his people and continue to help them. Hebrews 6:10
And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased. Hebrews 13:16
My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you John 5:12
Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one’s life for one’s friends. John 15:13
Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you. Luke 6:38
Give to the one who asks you, and do not turn away from the one who wants to borrow from you. Matthew 5:42
"Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to act."Proverbs 3:27
The generous will themselves be blessed, for they share their food with the poor. Proverbs 22:9

We love because he first loved us.Whoever claims to love God yet hates a brother or sister is a liar. For whoever does not love their brother and sister, whom they have seen, cannot love God, whom they have not seen. 1 John 4:19-20

Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out, a treasure in heaven that will never fail, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys. For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also. Luke 12:33-34

They also will answer, Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you? He will reply, Truly I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me. Matthew 25:44-45
What should we do then the crowd asked. John answered, Anyone who has two shirts should share with the one who has none, and anyone who has food should do the same. Luke 3:10-11

What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but has no deeds? Can such faith save them? Suppose a brother or a sister is without clothes and daily food. If one of you says to them, “Go in peace; keep warm and well fed,” but does nothing about their physical needs, what good is it? In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead. James 2:14-17

For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in, I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me...I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me. Matthew 25:35-40
Since you have been raised with Christ, set your heart on things above where Christ is seated at the right hand of God. Colossians 3:1
Let each of you look not only to his own interests, but also to the interests of others. Philippians 2:4
This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you. John 15:12
For there will never cease to be poor in the land. Therefore I command you, ‘You shall open wide your hand to your brother, to the needy and to the poor, in your land.’ Deuteronomy 15:11
Contribute to the needs of the saints and seek to show hospitality. Romans 12:13
For God is not unjust so as to overlook your work and the love that you have shown for his name in serving the saints, as you still do. Hebrews 6:10
Religion that is pure and undefiled before God the Father is this: to visit orphans and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained from the world. James 1:27
Let the thief no longer steal, but rather let him labor, doing honest work with his own hands, so that he may have something to share with anyone in need. Ephesians 4:28
Learn to do good; seek justice, correct oppression; bring justice to the fatherless, plead the widow's cause. Isaiah 1:17
If you pour yourself out for the hungry and satisfy the desire of the afflicted, then shall your light rise in the darkness and your gloom be as the noonday.Isaiah 58:10
For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them. Ephesians 2:10
Let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up. Galatians 6:9

Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain. –1 Corinthians 15:58
God is your place of safety. He gives you strength. He is always there to help you in times of trouble. Psalm 46:1
For God has not given you a spirit of fear but of power, love, and self-control. 2 Timothy 1:7
be alert, stand firm in the faith, be courageous, be strong. Do everything in love. 1 Corinthians 16:13-14
Fear not, for I have redeemed you; I have called you by name. You are mine. Isaiah 43:1

Come to me, when you are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest. Matthew 11:28

Let your hope make you glad. Be patient in times of trouble and never stop praying. Romans 12:12
May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in hIm, so that you may overflow with hope and the power of the Holy Spirit. Romans 15:13
